body: I think `BrokerServiceLookupTest` is a flaky test. there were issues tracking that. @zymap can you check if this test is using your change? If not you can just retest it.

> @18852996112 A client instance should be reused in a process.
> 
> > use netstat i find that the number of opened socket is increasing.
> 
> What's the state of this sockets? OS will keep the ports busy for some time after closing the sockets. Once the limit is reached, the process will fail to create new sockets.

 ESTABLISHED
I think this is work in progress https://gist.github.com/zymap/08ec1bb688d2da16e9cd363780480e7a
I will add test later. @sijie  PTAL.

Maybe later
@18852996112 Can you share your test code to reproduce the issue?
Broker should also set the max entry size on the BK client instance

run java8 tests

> Error does not reproduce on MacOS with
> 
> ```java
> for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
>     PulsarClient client = PulsarClient.builder()
>             .serviceUrl("pulsar://localhost:6650")
>             .build();
> 
>     Consumer<byte[]> consumer = client.newConsumer()
>            .topic("my-topic")
>            .subscriptionName("test")
>            .subscribe();
> 
>     client.close();
> }
> ```

In my last testing, i create connection and destroy the connection further slowly. Then  there's no that problem.  I think the season is OS keep the connection for some time.
thanks.

@sijie I created a separate PR for the activation dependency fix: https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/4256

@sijie I added another PR https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/4257 for including the pulsar-client-api into the shaded-jar in order to make the shaded-jar JPMS compatible. I really think this is necessary.

Unless you want to move the classes in the pulsar-client-api module and packages org.apache.pulsar.common.api and org.apache.pulsar.common.schema to other packages, Similar to what I originally attempted in this PR. That would make it possible to use pulsar-client and admin client with JPMS without using the shaded jar. I think this is the long-term solution, and I think it should be done at the next opportunity to change the public api as the change is very simple to implement.
I will now close this PR as the changes are available in two other separate PRs.
The changes were originally part of https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/4166
The changes were originally part of https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/4166

I'm not sure if there has been alignment wrt that pr.

@srkukarni then lets get into agreement what we should do about this problem. I just don't want multiple ways to get the same information and cluttering the context API.  We do need a simpler way to expose all the attributes of a Message so that we don't have to keep adding these one-off APIs to retrieve them.  Today someone asks for MessageId, tomorrow someone might ask for getting the key of the message.  I think we either allow users to consume Message<T> as input or from the context API we can get the underlying message.  I would be more in favor of the former, the one @sijie proposed

@ConcurrencyPractitioner @sijie @srkukarni lets continue progress in this as there are users waiting for this feature.  I am for with allowing functions to has ```Message<T>``` as an input as @sijie suggested.  Is everyone ok with that?
